陪.definition: to accompany; to keep sb company; to assist; old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]

陪侍.definition: to wait upon (older people); to accompany; attendant

陪床.definition: to look after a hospitalized loved one

陪睡.definition: to trade sex for favorable treatment (career advancement, higher grades, rent-free accommodation etc); to sleep in the same bed as one's child

陪聊.definition: to keep sb company for a chat; (esp.) to be a paid escort

陪葬.definition: to be buried with or next to dead person (of deceased's partner, or of funerary objects)

陪葬品.definition: funerary objects (items buried together with the dead)

陪襯.definition: to serve as a foil; to set off; a foil; a contrast

陪護.definition: to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc); caregiver

陪讀.definition: to accompany one's child or spouse who is studying overseas; to help a child with their study, reading or practicing together

陪送.definition: dowry; to give as a dowry; to accompany sb

陪都.definition: provisional capital of a country (e.g. in time of war); secondary capital; alternative capital
